Module the_project
Package food_related

Class MenuManipulator

java.lang.Object
food_related.MenuManipulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
AddStandard, Get, RemoveStandard, Set
public class MenuManipulator extends Object implements AddStandard, RemoveStandard, Set, Get
Instantiation of new food item details (food name, price and description) to be added into the Menu Upon adding, checks if there are existing entries available for the new food item If food entry is found, will check if food wants to be updated instead getArray returns reference to ArrayList object Allows existing food entry from the Menu to be removed Upon removal, check if the item number exist in the Menu If the item number requested for removal falls outside the Menu, i.e. it does not exist in the Menu, then exception is throw and error message displaying that food entry does not exist Modifications to existing food entries from the Menu Prior to the modification of food entries, choice given to either modify the existing food price, description or both If the new price or new description added is the same as before, i.e. no changes to the existing food in the Menu, then Exception is thrown and error message displaying that price/ description is the same. If none of the options chosen; message displaying for valid option to be chosen Exception would be thrown if there are any errors encountered along the way (new price the same or new description the same)
Since:
2022-03-15
Version:
7.0
Author:
Isaac, Yan kai, Davis, Wenlu, Tomoki

      public void addEntry() throws ArrayException
      Instantiation of new food item details (food name, price and description) to be added into the Menu Upon adding, checks if there are existing entries available for the new food item If food entry is found, will check if food wants to be updated instead getArray returns reference to ArrayList object

      Throws:
      ArrayException - occurs upon a duplicate entry

    • removeEntry

      public void removeEntry() throws ArrayException
      Allows existing food entry from the Menu to be removed Upon removal, check if the item number exist in the Menu If the item number requested for removal falls outside the Menu, i.e. it does not exist in the Menu, then exception is throw and error message displaying that food entry does not exist
      Specified by:
      removeEntry in interface RemoveStandard
      Throws:
      ArrayException - occurs when no entry found for its request to be removed

    • set

      public void set() throws ArrayException
      Modifications to existing food entries from the Menu Prior to the modification of food entries, choice given to either modify the existing food price, description or both If the new price or new description added is the same as before, i.e. no changes to the existing food in the Menu, then Exception is thrown and error message displaying that price/ description is the same. If none of the options chosen; message displaying for valid option to be chosen Exception would be thrown if there are any errors encountered along the way (new price the same or new description the same)
      Specified by:

      Throws:
